Content Officer Job at Mentally Aware Nigeria




        
    

        
        Mentally Aware Nigeria is founded on two core beliefs: first, that all possible steps should be taken to alleviate stigma and the suffering arising from it, caused by ignorance and an unbelievable silence and negligence towards the health of the mind, from federal setups down to the locales; and second, that it becomes known that those affected by this disaster (as depicted in the first point), have a right to life with dignity and therefore a right to assistance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Background
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Mentally Aware Nigeria Initiative is a youth-run and all of our staff and the majority of our volunteers fall within the age group of our primary target group.
	We have also co-designed our activities with and for young people who are engaged with our programming, including those with lived experience of mental health conditions.


Role Description


	This is a full-time, on-site role based in Lagos State, Nigeria, for a Content Officer.
	The Content Officer will be responsible for developing, managing, and implementing creative content across various platforms.
	Key duties include writing and editing mental health content, managing content within digital platforms, and coordinating social media campaigns to engage the organisation’s audience and promote mental health awareness.
	The role also involves collaborating with the team to execute a cohesive content strategy and ensuring alignment with the organisation’s goals.


Safeguarding Responsibilities


	Promote a culture of safeguarding by ensuring that all online interactions are respectful and safe.
	Ensure all content protects the dignity and privacy of individuals, particularly those with lived experience of mental health issues.


The purpose of this job shall be to:


	Create, improve, and maintain engaging content to promote a positive image of the organisation.
	Drive brand awareness by being involved in all stages of the communication process, from concept to message development to result-oriented evaluation.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Communication, or a related field.
	A minimum of 2 years of experience as a content officer, or a similar role, preferably within the non-profit or advocacy sector.
	Excellent knowledge of content creation.
	Ability to effectively use a variety of social media platforms and Analytic tools.
	Strong understanding of mental health issues, advocacy, and related terminologies.
	Computer Literate: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, WordPress.


Why Join Us?


	This role offers the opportunity to make a tangible difference in mental health advocacy and service delivery in Nigeria, while working in a supportive, mission-driven environment.

Payroll Specialist Job at Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company




        
    

        
        Coca-Cola HBC (Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company) is a bottling partner of The Coca-Cola Company. Coca-Cola HBC is headquartered in Zug, Switzerland and has a premium listing on the London Stock Exchange and secondary listing on the Athens Exchange. The Coca-Cola Company is the world's largest beverage company and operates in more than 200 countries.

Life at Coca-Cola HBC is fast-paced and challenging, with fair rewards and exciting learning opportunities. We promote an inclusive workplace, value diverse views and opinions and always appoint the best person for the job, ensuring equality in our shortlists and appointments. Take up the challenge. Join us!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Payroll Specialist

Job Location: Nigeria (Hybrid)

Job Description


	We are seeking a Payroll Specialist who will safeguard the accuracy and reliability of our entire payroll cycle: Coordinating inputs, partnering with People & Culture, Finance, and our external provider, and offering clear guidance to employees and managers on all payroll-related matters.


Key Responsibilities


	Collect, validate, and consolidate payroll data from multiple internal sources.
	Submit accurate inputs to the external payroll provider and follow the payroll calendar and statutory deadlines.
	Perform pre- and post-payroll checks, reconciliations, and variance analyses.
	Support internal/external audits and reporting requirements.
	Act as the primary contact for payroll questions; resolve discrepancies, retro adjustments, and employee case topics (incl. M4, pension records, coordination with PIO/RFZO).
	Communicate payroll process updates, timelines, and rules to stakeholders.
	Coordinate with the external payroll provider to ensure timely issue resolution.
	Maintain payroll documentation in line with GDPR and internal policies.
	Support Workday and Time & Attendance data accuracy and contribute to process improvements.


Requirements


	University Degree
	2-5 years of experience in similar roles.
	Experience working with payroll providers and payroll systems.
	Solid understanding of payroll principles, taxes, social contributions, and labor legislation.
	Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and accountability, service-oriented communication skills.
	Strong MS Excel skills (formulas, pivots, data validation).
